website_summaries.verdict: A popular interactive pull toy that's light on the wallet but heavy on features. Captures attention with lights and moving parts while sound features teach little ones about colors, numbers, and body parts.
pros: Cute design allows little ones to take their "puppy" for a walk
Music, sounds, and lights are activated by tugging the cord
Buttons help develop fine motor skills and introduce numbers and colors
Features over 60 songs, phrases, and sounds
Moving ears and legs are a novel touch
Comes with volume control and shuts off automatically when not in use
cons: Pull cord is on the short side and might need to be extended for taller children

customer_reviews.title: One Of The Best Toys To Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Owned for almost 2 months now with now 11 month old twin boys. They love this toy! Light up noise, cute songs, parts move when you pull the string, 2 sound settings and of course an off button! Numbers 1-3 on the spots with colors. Not only a great educational toy for your fast learning babies but inexpensive! Worth every penny. Owning now for almost 2 months with 2 babies that are not so gentle with toys and we have no issues with this toy. Batteries have and still holding up (we leave it on, never turn it off) no malfunctions. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Weston & Lacey Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this little doggy for my niece who just started walking and she loves i! It glides very easily behind her and it's light so she's able to tug it along. The ONLY thing that I didn't like was the string. the string was too thin and too short and the toy producer does not even make it easy for you to fix it by replacing the string. Since my niece just started walking, gripping is also a new task and the thin string is hard for her to manage. Also, she has to hold the very very end of the string so that's also very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Kei

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Learning and Fun Toy for Infants
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old granddaughter quickly learned how to bark like a puppy and said doggy within an hour. This is adorable, high quality and absolutely fun for the family to play and help the youngest in the family learn. She had a yellow dress on and everytime the puppy said find my yellow button, she pointed to her dress and the puppy's yellow button. Amazingly fun and interactive. Learning made fun for all! What we all have grown to love and expect from VTech!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Abbs

customer_reviews.title: Really Cute toy for a beginning walker or crawler!!
customer_reviews.text: This puppy is adorable and well loved by our one year old grandson who received it for his birthday! It does require batteries but has so many songs, sayings and fun, it is well worth the battery price as two last a loooong time!! One of the cuter toys for a beginning walker or crawler to pull around with him or her!! The almost three year old loves it, too!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Jones

customer_reviews.title: Safety and educationally made
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a birthday present. Sound is crisp. Voice is happy and at a pitch nthat attract a child. The pull string is the right length and not long enough to wrap around a child's head which makes this a plus for safety. It's anwell-made and entertaining toy.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Carroll

customer_reviews.title: My granddaughter is just 11 months old when she received ...
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter is just 11 months old when she received this and the string is too short for her to stand up and pull
customer_reviews.author: Bette Schulte

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: We like it, but it is a bit too short based and falls over easily. Our two year old likes walking it, but doesn't play with the sound at all. Cord also needs to be a little longer with something on the end to hold. It was too short for us to even tie a knot. Still in all she plays with it and drags it when it falls over
customer_reviews.author: Cas

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loved this toy until her tiny fingers started to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made, survived many falls and normal wear and tear you'd expect from a toddler. My daughter loved this toy until her tiny fingers started to get pinched while trying to rotate the ears. She will play with it here and there and we've owned it for maybe 6 months, so I believe that's a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: My LO best toy yet
customer_reviews.text: My 16 month old daughter loves this toy. She usually doesn’t play with her toys but she seems to like this one. The only problem is the string is too small for her to pull, so that’s why I added an extra one. Except that every thing works great and comes with lot of songs.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to buy this for my 16m daughter but I was not a fan overall. The string was too short and too thin that when my daughter grabbed it, the puppy would be off the ground. I put a thin doggy leash around it and that definitely helped. However, the toy is not very sturdy so when she pulls it a little hard (as many toddlers may), it easily falls to its side. Already used it so I can't return but I wouldn't recommend for a 16m old.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina R

customer_reviews.title: A WINNER!
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten two of these toys for my 7month old niece & nephew. They LOVE them. The tail clicks, the ears spin, I think it has a TON of different phrases- (mom's maybe don't think it has enough) When it keeps getting pulled around it eventually goes "I'm tired" which I think is too funny! If they don't touch it for awhile it'll say "come play with me" Overall a great value, an adorable toy & a total Aunt win!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany - Zaley Designs

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy, not a pull toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson who is 18 months old. I liked that it is a pull toy but once I received it I noticed the cord is way too short for that. The cord is only about 11 inches long which makes it too short. I called VTECH and they said the cord is supposed to be longer so I got a replacement from Amazon but the new one the cord is the same. Going to probably cut the cord off and just let my grandbaby push the toy. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: A must for any child, don't pass up this interactive educational toy
customer_reviews.text: Being a Fireman this was one of my first purchases for my newborn son, I had to get him this Dalmatian looking dog.. He is now old enough to play with it at 5 months he pushes the buttons and pulls the rope, he also loves to grab the keys the dogs holding and spin the tail.. I took a photo showing the other ones he has, these toys are a must for any child they are so interactive and my son loves them...
customer_reviews.author: Steve Crane

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: The Pull and Sing Puppy is simply Adorable and I just know my nephew is going to love this. He is 7 months old and starting to notice more things in his surroundings and anything that makes a noise or music he really responds to.. Thank you for such a precious learning toy..
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Cute and so durable!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is adorable and super cute I would definitely buy it again because of how durable it is. My daughter is very rough on her toys and slams this puppy down over and over and somehow he has still remained fully in tact. My only complaint would be how short the lease is but I'm sure that is for safety issues so we improvise and just looped some hair ties so she could hook her finger into it and drags the puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Erica  J

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating toy, but cute and not annoying.
customer_reviews.text: The string is quite short so the child/baby will have to bend over to pull the dog. This is probably a good safety feature since it can't get wrapped around the neck. However, it is irritating for the little one to use. The dog also says "I'm tired give me a break" after just a minute or two of play time and that encouraged my child to stop playing with it. It's not a very popular toy in my house. It's cute, not too annoying, rolls easily, and the buttons are easy to push though!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money didn’t work at all we tried everything.....
customer_reviews.author: Jon W.

customer_reviews.title: Too Top Heavy to Pull
customer_reviews.text: My grand daughter is at the perfect age for a pull toy and I bought this puppy for her to play with at my house. The string is too short for a pull toy and the puppy is top heavy and keeps falling over. Not at all pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Keli

customer_reviews.title: This was a huge hit with my niece!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my great niece who recently turned one. My gift was the first one she opened and this puppy pull toy was one of 3 things in the box. From the moment she saw it, nothing else in the box mattered and no one else's gift mattered! She wouldn't put the puppy down! The cost of this is minimal, it works well and she loves it. I didn't have any issues with the "leash" being short, it's long enough for her to pull it and not get tangled and trip over it. I highly recommend this as a gift!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tips over easily
customer_reviews.text: The toy we received has a pull string barely a foot long. String is too short for child walk and pull. The dog is constantly falling over. I imagine it's short to avoid accidents, but I bought it to be a pull toy. I noticed later, some of the pictures are a little deceiving about the string...I call it string, because it's too thin to be a cord. So....easy fix...we tied additional string to it and works better, but still not that stable. It's a cute doggie, but maybe not the best pull toy. Probably best part is the light on his nose. Toy has a ton of great reviews, but I can't agree.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: My 20-month old niece loves this toy...Only wish the string was longer
customer_reviews.text: My niece is 20 months old. She loves this toy. To be honest, I don't think she uses the buttons or songs that much, but she loves dragging it around. The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because they really need to make the string longer. I saw someone post that same comment before I purchases and after seeing her with the toy, the string is not nearly long enough. Because its so short, she ends up dragging it on its side rather than on the wheels, which isn't great but thats my only quarrel about the product. Otherwise great toy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: matt hodin

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift for my grandson of 15 months
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute puppy with buttons and music, My grandson just recently started walking and loves to pull things behind him. He loves the floppy ears and loves the push button nose. The string is really short so my daughter added a little more string. But I guess they can't have it too long otherwise kids can trip or get the toy wrapped around tables and chairs and fall down. But he loves it and has fun playing with it. It is really hard to find toys for the younger toddler age kids that will keep their interest for longer than a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Joni Nielson

customer_reviews.title: Pull string is way too short
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my one year old for Christmas and just got around to taking it out of the box. It’s cute, however, the pull string is way to short. It’s maybe 7-8 inches long. When my daughter holds the string, the toy barely touches the ground. She wants to pull it but can’t. I wish I would have unboxed this sooner bc I would have returned it. I’m really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Robinson

customer_reviews.title: very good buy I like
customer_reviews.text: My 16 months old just held it by the tail and bang it on the floor, very good buy I like, put it up until when he's ready for it.
customer_reviews.author: renae

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but limitied use
customer_reviews.text: So, right out of the box the string (leash) snapped...setting off 'tears' in my grand daughter. Dad 'fixed' it, by tying it in a knot, but now too short even for a 15 month old. I was also under the impression from the description that this dog was more interactive than it is. Really limited to a few tasks off the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: keds

customer_reviews.title: It can’t be pulled. Not worthy
customer_reviews.text: The string length is so small. It’s not lengthy enough for a two year old. And the head is fixed to one and it topples all the time when kids pulls them around. This is just a normal toy and no means can be used for pulling around the house. If you are looking for pulling around look out for the ducks. They are way good and well done
customer_reviews.author: Venkat Raman

customer_reviews.title: OK, but the kitten is way way better
customer_reviews.text: PROS: its a puppy, bought 2 for my Grandsons, age 1yr- 2. CONS: not as great as the kittens, that I also bought for my 2 grand daughters. The boys still want the kittens. I won't buy again. Not enough buttons to keep the boys interested, they keep going after the kittens.
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: Cute learning toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a one-year-old's birthday present. She loves animals, so I thought it would be perfect. The cute face and colorful buttons kept her busy for a few minutes, but when she got up to walk it, she grabbed the "leash" and the puppy immediately flipped on it's side. We'd continue to stand it on it's feet, but it wouldn't pull that way, so she'd just pull it, laying on it's side. It bothered us adults, but she didn't seem to care.
customer_reviews.author: JustMeVB

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of the string
customer_reviews.text: My son likes this toy ok (not his fave) but the string part definitely makes me nervous. I know there is a string compartment which I tried to use but I couldn’t get it to stay in there securely and it would come back out of the compartment within <1 min of him playing with it. The instructions didn’t explain in detail how to use the string compartment so I’m not 100% sure i was even putting it in right. I wish the string part was detachable altogether so I wouldn’t have to worry but once he gets older it won’t be as big of a deal
customer_reviews.author: Lea B

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing for a Vtech toy!
customer_reviews.text: Pull cord is far too short for any use what so ever! Fortunately I do know how to macrame and can do so to the cord with a cotton cord used for candle making. Colors and numbers are taught, pleasant enough voice and the little legs move and the dog is pulled. No child could use this as a pull toy but I think if I lengthen the cord (shame on them for not engineering this better for a child!!), it will become a very nice walking toy up and down sidewalks. If you're not handy, DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Great Baby to Toddler Gift!
customer_reviews.text: And Just like That, I bought this toy Right Before Friend Added to a Birthday List! We both knew “Perfect!” Of course, I had to try the buttons- you know.. Toy inspection Excuse to turn on! It has On/Off and You Choose Regular Sound to Louder Sound. Times nose lights up is Cute! Buttons pressed have different sayings. Plus, easy for baby to toddler to pull around. Luv It!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it but string is WAY TOO SHORT
customer_reviews.text: My daughter always love dog but my building doesn't allow dogs. This is the best I can give her :) She loves it. I like the songs, not too annoying ;p despite all the comments about the string being too short, i'm surprised the manufacturer hasn't do anything about it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ada

customer_reviews.title: Short leash
customer_reviews.text: This is the cutest toy. My great granddaughter loved it, but she became so frustrated with the short leash. The puppy kept turning over and she would stop to set upright. Started pulling it and right away it was on its side again. That was the only negative thing about that cute toy. I would buy it again, but before I gave it to a child, I would tie a longer string on for the leash.
customer_reviews.author: floridagal

customer_reviews.title: Not a pull toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cute puppy! He barks and his little nose lights up. He counts and says the numbers and colors. My 1 yrs. old granddaughter loves playing with him. The only thing that is rather dissapointing is the string is seriously short! You are suppose to pull him around, but it is not long enough for even a one year old to stand and pull. I understand the concern for child safety, but the short string defeats the purpose of a pull toy.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Aust-Vance

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Loved that it's not loud and you can still hear it. I wish the string was alittle bit longer than it is(im thinking it isnt because it could be a choking hazard? Idk what child that would wrap this around their neck but you never know) but for now it's just right but my grandson takes this little dog everywhere we go. Arrived on time since this was a Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Serich

customer_reviews.title: Very strong and long lasting toy
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this toy, she is 9 months old and that is the only toy that she loves to play with, she loves the music and it makes different sound everytime she moves the puppy around. She has dropped this toy from her high chair way too many times it doesnt have a single crack or scratch and it still plays and looks as new. She plays woth it almost everyday. She's had it for more than 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena n.

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my niece’s 1-year old son for Christmas. It was awesome! The lights, shapes, and songs this plays really was the best! This isn’t what we had as children. (Remember the wooden puppy dog?) This is a playful looking puppy that can take tiny toddlers banging or hitting it. It was worth every penny to see his little eyes light up Christmas Day!
customer_reviews.author: texicanwife

customer_reviews.title: Hit or Miss - nothing special
customer_reviews.text: 1 year old granddaughter seems indifferent about this toy. It does make noise. Has a long string. Maybe she’s still too young. I also purchased one for 18 month old girl.
customer_reviews.author: INDY MOM

customer_reviews.title: Ears and tail do not electronically move
customer_reviews.text: Originally, I sent this back because I was under the assumption that the ears and the tail were supposed to wag on their own when you walk the puppy. This is not true, they move but not on their own. I believe other people have returned this product because they thought the puppies ears and tail were supposed to electronically move but they do not. Just a heads up.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Adorable Dalmation Learning Toy
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this toy for a child this Christmas who was at a shelter for homeless families. It was a joy to give this toy to make a little one smile & to help a struggling family provide gifts this season. This toy dog has all that it says in the descript, sure to keep a child busy throughout their days :)
customer_reviews.author: Justice60

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter have this for a year and more now. It's one of her favorite toy. I bought two and gifted it to another little girl for her birthday. It was a beautiful one year old birthday gift. I had to extend the string so my daughter could actually play with it but it's a great toy. Get my 100% recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Abby S.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother..
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter after reading the reviews but was disappointed. The puppy doesn’t do much other than a couple of sounds and moving it’s leg while pulling the string. And even the string is just bout a feet in length. My daughter didn’t bother playing with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: NaSh

customer_reviews.title: Very educational
customer_reviews.text: Totally adorable toy. The sound and the music is not very overwhelming for both kids and adults. Very educational with several nursery rhymes. Option to learn numbers and colors. I personally feel if the end of the thread had a ring or something similar, it would have a good grip to pull the toy around.
customer_reviews.author: CBEL

customer_reviews.title: Cute and one of baby's favorites.
customer_reviews.text: Very cute and the baby loves it. I would buy it again for her but I wish the puppy had a better/larger repertoire. I think there are three instrumental songs and maybe three phrases one of which is, 'I need a rest.'. Just struck me as a little bit of a lazy phrase? But she loves to watch his little legs move when the puppy walks...it really is cute.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Saint

customer_reviews.title: So Dang Cute, Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: So darn Cute, this little pup entertains my 3 month old Grandson daily:-), My daughter takes this little Pup every where they go with my Grandson, (she named him Lucky) :-) Highly Recommended Great Quality, Makes a nice shower gift Worth every penny!!! :-)
customer_reviews.author: REBECCA

customer_reviews.title: toy was a hit but the leash is ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: this leash was too short for an average heighted 14 months old to stand up and pull along. she tried to carry it over her shoulder like a sack, which turned it into a weapon really. Its also not sturdy when pulled by the tiny string. The "leash" should be much thicker and longer, and have a handle as would any real leash. The kid loved it though
customer_reviews.author: Ronald P. Caron

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Singing Voice on the Toy
customer_reviews.text: The voice talent used for this toy SUCKS! He barely stays on pitch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken toy delivered
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and opened it for my 1 year old for a Valentine gift and the ears dont work, huh. Sad and bothered that we might have to return it. We are going to figure it out. Low starts for now. If we can fix it then I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Rodezno Family

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, sturdy little puppy with happy sounds. The only reason it did not get a five star rating is the length of the "leash." It is way too short, even for my one-year-old granddaughter. I remedied that by tying a shoelace to the "leash". It works well, and she doesn't have to stoop to pull the puppy along.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: Cute and colorful toy but short leash string
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 18 month old son and he was so excited. He loves animals so I was excited to see that the toy dog had a leash with a string for him to pull. When we opened the toy, it looked like someone had cut the string to the leash, I have to say I was a little disappointed because this is such a cute toy. Other than that, it's a good toy and my son really likes it.
customer_reviews.author: DrFso

customer_reviews.title: Pull and Sing Puppy!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love vtech toys, my only complaint about this pull and sing puppy would be the string, it's extremely short. We had to tie another string to it, not a big deal but it stuck out to us when our daughter starting playing with it and trying to pull it along.
customer_reviews.author: Moises

customer_reviews.title: Pull String is Too Short
customer_reviews.text: The pull string is about a foot long and my 18 month old cannot stand up and pull at the same time. That was the whole point of me purchasing it. So I had to scrounge around and find something else to tie onto it so he can actually pull it. So it looks a little janky now, but he likes the moving parts and the sounds it makes. The pictures are inaccurate that show the toddler holding the string almost above her head.
customer_reviews.author: Britt Callender

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for toddlers too!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8 month old niece. She loved it and so did her 5 year old sister. It's very interactive even without it being powered on. The ears and tail clock and the pull string is great for the kids to pretend they are walking the doggy.
customer_reviews.author: Yesi

customer_reviews.title: Really cute
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 9-10 m/o nephew. He doesn't yet walk so doesn't pull the string -- but likes to chew on the string! Pushes the buttons and spends quite a while with this toy without seeming to get bored.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: String way to short.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good toy it's only down fall is how short the string is. The string is about 10in long if that. It's alright if my kid is sitting and just pulling the dog around but it is nowhere near long enough to pull while walking.
customer_reviews.author: otua

customer_reviews.title: Not a Pull Toy
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is adorable; and was well received. That said, I purchased as a pull toy for 17 month old, average size toddler. Pull-string is much too short to use for this purpose, and has to be carried.... and then thrown to the floor as toddlers love to do. Not sure yet how much of this toddler abuse the puppy will withstand. If you're looking for a pull toy, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't hear it
customer_reviews.text: Cute dog toy, baby loves it, but you can hardly hear the sounds that's supposed to come out of it. The volume won't adjust any further up to make it louder. But baby's mom was okay with that Lol. 4 stars because you can't hear it but mom says it's okay.
customer_reviews.author: Ced&Anna

customer_reviews.title: Dog Needs a Longer Leash!
customer_reviews.text: Like the product itself but the string to pull it is very short for an average size 1 year old- it ends up being knocked over on its side.
customer_reviews.author: KAH

customer_reviews.title: Good product, should have longer thread
customer_reviews.text: Good product but the thread to pull is just too short, its hardly 10 inches long. I am big fan of vtech toys and I already have walker, activity center, pull bulldozer, etc. This purchase is bit disappointing due to thread length as my 1yr who is approximate 3 feet tall can’t walk with it properly. I can’t return it now as I damaged box packing while opening.
customer_reviews.author: Deep Patel

customer_reviews.title: He is really cute but not functional.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift. He walks on leash, but leash is really short & he falls over easily. Not appropriate for a young child 1-2. They pull too hard & the dog toppled over. Maybe ok for an older child, but I think they would be bored.
customer_reviews.author: L Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Pull String?
customer_reviews.text: Cool toy except for the pull string. Seriously? not even a foot long. Kid can't effectively drag the dog, may as well throw it to get it to walk.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Forman

customer_reviews.title: A babys pull along friend!
customer_reviews.text: He sings,talks,counts numbers. He's a magical little puppy that responds to crawling or walking along. He absolutely puts a smile on my 1yr.old grandson. This little magical friend brings so much joy. I love him myself! Watch the look on your child or grandchilds face when they pull the puppy along and it starts to talk or sing with his red nose blinking just like Rudolphs! You'll fall in love too!
customer_reviews.author: Babcha

customer_reviews.title: Ever so cute
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my granddaughter who was too little at the time of purchase to enjoy it, but is now responding to all the interactive things this pull along puppy does. So glad that it is both entertaining and educational.
customer_reviews.author: Margret N.

customer_reviews.title: String too short otherwise it’s absolutely great.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this toy except the string being too short. My son just turned one and it’s too short for him to pull the puppy. We attached a ribbon to make it long but just wish the string came longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeni Khadge

customer_reviews.title: Pull along puppy
customer_reviews.text: I have a new great grandson who is 1 1/2 years of age and I got him this puppy for Christmas and he just loves it which made me a very happy Grandma. It is rated from new born to 6 years of age so he should get a lot of use out of it. Patty Wilhelm
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L. Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: It makes noise and my grandson loves it.
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my 1 year old grandson..I added additional string and a button on the end so that he could pull it..the short string that comes with is too short ..but otherwise it is a good toy..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy grandson
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old grandson loves his dog plays with it all the time he now has a dog,a duck and a dinosaur at my house so he is always playing with them a great toy for a boy or girl
customer_reviews.author: Linda Yoak

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Our 8 month old grandson is intrigued by this, he stares and pulls and kisses on it, he takes it to bed to nap always by his side, very durable no sharp edges. Great purchase for the young.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, short string
customer_reviews.text: My 16 month daughter loves this puppy. We have two other dogs so she loves to pull this one around & give it the real dog toys! A pretty big bummer was that the string is SOO short, not possible for her to pull it around so we just tied some macrame cord to it to for additional length.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Quality is good wish leash were longer
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter adores this little puppy...however, the leash provided is too short. My granddaughter is almost 18 months and is tall for her age. When she attempts to pull the puppy with leash provided the puppy flips on it's side.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Goldyn

customer_reviews.title: Short String, Falls Over
customer_reviews.text: I thought my toddler would love this because she loves her original Fisher Price pull along puppy, without songs or anything. However this string is super short in comparison, and the puppy almost always falls over when you try to pull him. Especially on carpet. Had it for a year. She’s only grabbed it a handful of times and never for long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not bad but a little noisy
customer_reviews.text: overall this toy is not bad. but it little bit noisy because wheels are made from plastic. And my baby does not like to play with this dog until I start to show her how to play.
customer_reviews.author: Elena Grebneva

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: Noises are crickety. Not much to the toy itself. Very flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Somerset

customer_reviews.title: Present to my niece !
customer_reviews.text: I got this cute little puppy for my 1 year old niece. She love it . It plays music, songs and numbers. Its attractive for the very little ones. I was really happy to see my niece playing with the cute little puppy. Excellent gift.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Educational & Cute
customer_reviews.text: Not a dislike but a concern - this will be a gift for a 1 year old who can be rough & I hope the ears/tail/legs are not easily removable. Otherwise fun toy - very educational colorful movable & will prepare the toddler for having a pet.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: ENGAGING TOY
customer_reviews.text: I Absolutely Love This Puppy Toy. 100% Excellent Teaching Toy. Great Sound Effect Vocals... Adorable! Holds Child's Intrest for Entire Play Time. Buying More for My Gift Closet. ✔ 5 ***** X 2
customer_reviews.author: Renee Saint-James

customer_reviews.title: expected better
customer_reviews.text: the toy is cute, but not a solid quality I expected for the price, it is cheap plastic all the functions work, it did entertain my grandaugher some but she was far more interested in the real dog. lol
customer_reviews.author: John Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great for young kids.
customer_reviews.text: This was great for my granddaughter. She actually started walking by pulling her little toy dog around. She threw it and it was dropped more than once. And it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie  Victorino

customer_reviews.title: string too short to be useful
customer_reviews.text: We have a short/average sized 1 year old and she is too tall to use this because they were cheap with the string and made it too short. It needs to be about 1.5-2 feet longer than what it is (about 1 foot).
customer_reviews.author: M. Erdman

customer_reviews.title: String too short
customer_reviews.text: Cute toy for toddlers. However, the string to pull the puppy is about 12” long. This doesn’t make any sense and we had to attach another string to it. The point of the toy is to walk the dog around. How can you do that with a string this short?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top rated toy
customer_reviews.text: I gave this for my nephew as a Christmas gift - it is so cute I want to play with it - He wull definitely learn from this - I ourchased this because it got a high rating on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Borg

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a small child.
customer_reviews.text: The toy works as it should. It stands up to what my son does. I wouldn’t wanted the string to be longer. It’s not quite long enough for the dog to actually trail behind.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy!
customer_reviews.text: My niece loves this toy and she is 6 months old! The colors and sounds are fun for her and I like that it will help her learn. I would have rated 5/5 but the pull string seems to be a safety hazard. She tried to put the string in her mouth so we tied a large object to the end so she would not swallow the string.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon B

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy.
customer_reviews.text: Cute toy. Better for 1 1/2 years and up due to finger dexterity. Be sure to turn off before going to bed. Scared the begeezus out of us when it went off in the middle of the night.!
customer_reviews.author: ZGPD

customer_reviews.title: Retro feel in durable plastic. Cute gift.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad toy...but my son isn't into it yet, and it's lightweight so it flops over easily. I love the ears and tail. It's a very cheap toy price wise...and a great toy for the price! I have the cuddly cow and more complex V-Tech toys and my son is into them all.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Q. Contrary

customer_reviews.title: Pull string too short to pull
customer_reviews.text: Love the toy itself, but the string is only about 1 foot long causing the kids to swing it because the string is too short to pull it. Seems like it should be long enough to pull behind a child. Currently my grands are 2 1/2 & 1 1/2 and it isnt long enough for either kiddo to pull. I realize the company is worried about it wrapping around a kids neck, but maybe just not add a string then. We ended up having to cut it off because they were accidentally swinging it around.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Love if had longer pull string!
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter and I picked out this puppy and she would love it if it had longer string to pull it around. I have tried putting one on but not my job. Please make the string longer for other toddlers
customer_reviews.author: Mary2

customer_reviews.title: Cute, cute, cute
customer_reviews.text: Sweet little tag along puppy. The cord is a little short but add a piece of string. Not a problem. How his little legs move - he’s is adorable.
customer_reviews.author: Nandi Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Really nice toy!
customer_reviews.text: Really cute toy very durable my daughter loves it! but the string is a little short so she can't walk with it but other then that it is educational and fun for the kids to play with so I recommend it especially if your kid like dogs!!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Shapleigh

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GIFT IDEA !  Children LOVE this!  Great for NEWBORN to watch until ready to play!
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine had two new grand babies and I bought two of these for presents. The family LOVED the idea! It is such a cute gift as ALL VTech toys are! It is educational and fun!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Quick fun gift
customer_reviews.text: This is my first review ever!! My niece is turning 1 in a month and I wanted to get her some gifts. She came to visit me and I just couldn’t wait. She saw it and her eyeballs were popping out. I find that the colors on the dog really grab her attention. She played with it for an hour. She threw it on the floor and it didn’t even break. Very fun and affordable gift Would buy again for future gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Kattie Chaclan

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy for baby
customer_reviews.text: Funny to see my daughter take care of the dog. I though it was gonna Less of qualify but actually it’s decent for the price
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase! Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy when I opened this box to see this cute puppy, and I had everyone coming to test it out at the office!! They all loved it as well! Great gift for a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 9 Month Old Loves It
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Christmas for a nine month old boy. His eyes lit up when he first saw it and played with it right away and is still a toy he always has around him. Lights up, plays music and sounds and he just smiles at it all the time babbling at it. His 2 year old sister loves it too always walks around pulling it. You buy toys hopping the child smiles and enjoys them. This toy got that done big time.
customer_reviews.author: boblansing

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommended
customer_reviews.text: I brought this little talking doggy for my baby when he was 8 month old now his two year old still playing with it never changed the battery not once I dont regretted I was buying it for him I totally recommended is a very good choice go head grab yours for your kids
customer_reviews.author: Magdala D.

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy!
customer_reviews.text: Love this dog. It's a very cute toy and the noises it makes are cute. My 18 month old loves pulling the toy around. I wish the string was a little longer but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Diandra Bucksbee

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my grandson for Christmas ( he was 9 months at the time) and he loves it! It is well made and great learning toy. He loves playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toy puppy
customer_reviews.text: The toy is great and my grand baby enjoys it while NOT pulling it along. The only problem is that the string/leash is too short and thin. She doesn’t play with it very long once she tries to walk the puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Pammy

customer_reviews.title: Great as a gift!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a birthday present for a 1 year old. Great price and such a cute present. How can I go wrong with a singing puppy? :)
customer_reviews.author: carolyf

customer_reviews.title: This lil puppy is just great.
customer_reviews.text: My toddler granddaughter loves this. This lil pup also takes a lickin and keeps on moving right along. It is easy to clean with just a wiping with a damp cloth. It also has great things to aid with her development.
customer_reviews.author: avery gee

product_meta.title: VTech Pull and Sing Puppy
product_meta.description: Get ready for fun and adventures with the Pull and Sing Puppy. This playful interactive puppy loves to follow you around. Pull the puppy by its cord to activate music and sounds, see the puppy's legs move and watch the keys swing. Press the colorful buttons to introduce numbers, colors and parts of the body. The buttons also play songs, playful phrases, melodies and cute puppy sounds. The puppy's nose flashes along with the sounds and music plays when the puppy rolls. Intended for ages 6-36 months. Requires 2 AAA batteries. Batteries included for demo purposes only. New batteries recommended for regular use.
feature_bullets: Push or pull the playful puppy using the cord to activate music while building gross motor skills
Three colorful buttons promote fine motor skill development in toddlers
Introduces numbers, colors and parts of the body; plays music and puppy sounds to promote language development in a playful way
Light-up nose flashes along with all voice, sound and musical responses to attract your little one’s attention
Intended for ages 6-36 months; requires 2 AAA batteries; batteries included for demo purposes only; new batteries recommended for regular use
